summary: Email exchange between attorney Brad Edwards and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the need for a signed protective order before disclosing an agreement related to the Epstein case. The communication shows coordination between the defense and prosecution on procedural matters.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Attorney representing a party in the Epstein case, communicating with a U.S. Attorney about signing and faxing a protective order to receive an agreement.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from West Palm Beach, Florida, corresponding with Brad Edwards about obtaining a signed protective order before sending an agreement.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding procedural steps (protective order) needed for disclosure of an agreement in the Epstein case.

events.title: Email exchange about protective order
events.description: Email correspondence between Brad Edwards and an Assistant U.S. Attorney discussing the need for a signed protective order before the agreement can be disclosed.

keyFacts: Brad Edwards, an attorney, was involved in the Epstein case and corresponded with a federal prosecutor.
A protective order needed to be signed before an agreement could be disclosed, indicating confidentiality concerns.
The email exchange shows procedural coordination between defense and prosecution in 2008.
The document is marked as privileged and confidential, highlighting the sensitive nature of the communications.
